latex: Let $p(x)$ be a polynomial with integer coefficients such that $p(0)=p(1)=1$. We define the sequence $a_0, a_1, a_2, \ldots, a_n, \ldots$ that starts with an arbitrary nonzero integer $a_0$ and satisfies $a_{n+1}=p(a_n)$ for all $n \in \mathbb N\cup \{0\}$. Prove that $\gcd(a_i,a_j)=1$ for all $i,j \in \mathbb N \cup \{0\}$.
